  • Method Details

    • findValWhat

      public static boolean findValWhat(int[][] m, int val)
      checks if a specific value exists in the array, the algorithm starts from the upper right corner and checks whether the value is smaller/higher than the current number, if its smaller we'll "remove" one column, if it's higher we'll "remove" one row. in that way we're certain that at max checks we'll reach n checks - O(n) time complexity. we defined 3 variables(n, i, j) that none of them is an array - O(1) space complexity.
      Parameters:
      m - 2d array
      val - desired value to find in the array
      Returns:
      true if the value is in the array, false if not.

    • findValTest

      public static boolean findValTest(int[][] m, int val)
      checks if a specific value is in the array. we have 4 for loops that runs until n, none of the loops are nested - time complexity of O(n) we defined 5 variables(n, row, i, k, j) that none of them is an array - space complexity of O(1)
      Parameters:
      m - 2d array
      val - desired value to find in the array
      Returns:
      true if the value found the array, false if not

    • strictlyIncreasing

      public static int strictlyIncreasing(int[] a)
      the method will look into an array and will check how many sub arrays exists that arranged in ascending order. we have one for loop that runs until n-1 -> time complexity of O(n). we defined 4 variables(n, counter, sequence, i), none of them is an array - space complexity of O(1).
      Parameters:
      a - 1d array
      Returns:
      the number of sub arrays that are arranged in an ascending order.

    • longestFlatSequence

      public static int longestFlatSequence(int[] arr)
      the method will return a number that represents the length of the longest flat sequence series. flat sequence series in this case is a sub array which all the numbers in it are the same number or the numbers are consecutive numbers(2 numbers at most).
      Parameters:
      arr - a 1d array contains only integers.
      Returns:
      a number that represents the length of the longest flat sequence series.

    • findMaximum

      public static int findMaximum(int[][] mat)
      the method will get a 2d array that contains the numbers -1, 0, 1. the method will serve as a root that starts from [0][0] which can only go through numbers that are 0 or 1(if it goes through 0 we will add 0 points to the sum of the route, if it goes through 1 we'll add 1 point to the route). if the array row index is even it can only go right/down, if it's odd it can only go left/down. eventually we'll return the route's sum that was the highest.
      Parameters:
      mat - 2d array that contains only the numbers -1, 0, 1.
      Returns:
      the highest points that possible in the route.
